text: at the fall wedding of Luke we hakken
and Laura girar Oh
the star attraction was not the historic
chapel
not the scenic location overlooking
downtown Pittsburgh
not the bride and groom it is my great
pleasure to introduce Luke and Laura we
Hagen not even the four tier wedding
cake it was this cookie table shrouded
in mystery a table filled with dozens
and dozens and dozens of cookies is a
long standing wedding tradition in
western Pennsylvania people argue about
where the tradition comes from some say
it was brought over by Italians others
pin it on the pole and a few people in
Youngstown Ohio claim it as theirs -
whatever the case many weeks before the
wedding the bride and a cluster of aunts
and moms gathered to bake and bake and
then bake some more cookie recipes are
typically passed down from generation to
generation the Gerar family is known for
pit sells anise or chocolate flavored
cookies pressed in an item the spritz
here a pink tinge butter cookie our aro
family favorite aunt Elaine makes lady
LOX a filled cookie like a mini cannoli
but with cream inside instead of ricotta
all in all about 2,000 cookies are
packed up to be displayed on the cookie
table at the wedding and once the
cookies are unveiled guests rush to
sample as many different flavors as they
can
you like you better okay chocolate chip
